revised_title: A Case Study of a 46-Year Pregnancy
tldr: The case study examines a woman who carried a fetus for 46 years before her death. Despite giving birth to two children during this time, the fetus remained inside her body. Upon her death, a surgeon discovered a large mass, which they believed to be the cause of the prolonged pregnancy. The case raises questions about the nature of pregnancy and the potential for medical advancements in understanding and treating such cases.
